ARABIC: وَلَا تَقْفُ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌ إِنَّ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْبَصَرَ وَٱلْفُؤَادَ كُلُّ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ كَانَ عَنْهُ مَسْـُٔولًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do not pursue what you have no knowledge of. Hearing, sight and hearts will all be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Verily the ear, the eye, the heart, each will be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (xiii) Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Surely the hearing, the sight, the heart - each of these shall be called to account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do not follow what you do not know; the ears, eyes, and hearts will all be held responsible for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And do not pursue the matter you do not have the knowledge of; indeed the ear, and the eye, and the heart – each of these will be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And follow not that of which you have no knowledge. Verily, the hearing, and the sight, and the heart of each of those ones will be questioned (by Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And follow not that of which you have not the knowledge; surely the hearing and the sight and the heart, all of these, shall be questioned about that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And pursue not that thou hast no knowledge of; the hearing, the sight, the heart -- all of those shall be questioned of.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (O man), follow not that whereof thou hast no knowledge. Lo! the hearing and the sight and the heart - of each of these it will be asked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do not follow what you do not know; for the ear and the eye and the heart shall all be called to account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And go not thou after that where of thou hast no knowledge verily the hearing and the sight and the heart, each of these shall be asked about.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed hearing, eyesight, and the heart—all of these are accountable.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And pursue not that of which thou hast no knowledge; for every act of hearing, or of seeing or of (feeling in) the heart will be enquired into (on the Day of Reckoning).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And follow not (O man i.e., say not, or do not or witness not, etc.) that of which you have no knowledge (e.g. one's saying: "I have seen," while in fact he has not seen, or "I have heard," while he has not heard). Verily! The hearing, and the sight, and the heart, of each of those you will be questioned (by Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do not follow what you do not know. The hearing, sight and heart about all these you shall be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And do not occupy yourself with what you have no knowledge of. The hearing, and the sight, and the brains—all these will be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:36] And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed the hearing and the sight and the heart — of each of these it will be asked, of that person what he did with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((0 man), follow not) say not (that whereof thou hast no knowledge) whereby you say: I know, when you have no knowledge; or say: I saw, when you have not seen anything; or say: I heard, when you have not heard anything. (Lo! the hearing) that which you hear (and the sight) and that which you see (and the heart) and that which you hope for (of each of these) about each of these (it will be asked) on the Day of Judgement.
